channel.title: Need help/advice from a java person!
channel.description:
client.java:6016: illegal start of expression public boolean cannonowner() { ^ client.java:31967: ';' expected }; ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .
How do i fix these?! Thanks +rep if helpde

item.title: Need help/advice from a java person!
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Where that boolean is, make sure that you have closed the previous procedure.

As for the bracket, go to the line before that one and add a “;” at the end.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help/advice from a java person!
item.dc:creator: @3_HITTED_U 3 HITTED U
item.description:
@3_HITTED_U wrote:

Thanks for the quick reply, but where do I put that boolean? it was where its allways been its allways worked…

client.java:6016: illegal start of expression
public boolean cannonowner() {
^
client.java:31967: ‘;’ expected
}
^
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

is what i got the second time, same error.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help/advice from a java person!
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

The boolean is in the wrong place.
Remove the “;” from the end of the “}”.

Read full topic
